column4: Hi guys, I'm running ubuntu on my fathers laptop, compiz keeps segfaulting everytime he tries to swtich windows, he has a radeon hd 5400 series card, suggestions? I am not too familiar with ubuntu, what drivers are recommended, can I switch off this compiz thing or is it heavily incorporated in gnome/unity?
do you want to use Unity?
well I want him to have a system that is easy to use and doesn't crash. My mother also use ubuntu on her laptop so they should have the same identical layout.
okay. But I want to try switching drivers first, do you have a suggestion for that, for the radeon?
I use Ubuntu Classic myself, looks very much like Gnome2 and is very fast, XFCE and LXDE are also very fast
Thing is, my parents aren't too computer savvy, they are pretty used to the defaults.
I'll see if i can switch drivers, if not I will try default gnome 3
yes, but with modifications, am i wrong?
and it doesn't rely on compiz?
I'm running gnome 3 on arch linux here, it doesn't rely on compiz at all.
yeah, like I said: Unity = gnome3 + some eye candy
hmm, just ran unity --reset , it seems that it doesn't crash any longer. What exactly does it do?
i guess it resets compiz to defaults, glad you found it :)
